alert.note: Alert for Childress (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 04 at 8:19PM CDT until June 05 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Lubbock TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Prairie Dog Town Fork Red River near Childress 10N affecting Childress County. For the Prairie Dog Town Fork Red River...including Childress 10N... Minor flooding is ongoing. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Prairie Dog Town Fork Red River near Childress 10N. * WHEN...From this evening to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Cattle grazing in the flood plain are threatened by rising water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM CDT Sunday was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.2 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.2 feet on 06/02/1973. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM CDT.
